name: TikTok LIVE
primary_goal_vibe: Real-time connection, Q&A, community building, and deeper engagement with followers.
tone_preference: Unfiltered, responsive, and energetic. Still aligned with brand, but more conversational and improvisational.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: The Live title and description must clearly state the topic and why viewers should join now. Keep the description short and benefit-focused. During the Live, repeat the main value and CTA often as new viewers join.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: topic and benefit. Description: 1–3 lines explaining what will happen and who it is for. Include a single main CTA (follow, visit profile, or ask questions).
cta_examples: Follow so you do not miss the next LIVE
Ask your questions in the chat
Tap follow and stay until the end
Share this LIVE with someone who needs it
Check the link in bio for details

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Support late joiners and keep the topic clear.
best_practices: Use pinned comments to restate topic and CTA
Avoid cluttering the screen with overlays
If using text overlays, keep them short and clear

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: Use a few relevant hashtags in the Live announcement posts, not inside the Live itself.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Focus on topic consistency and series tags.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag co-hosts or guests in the announcement content.

technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 20–60 minutes depending on audience size and topic.
technical_constraints.connection_note: Test connection, lighting, and audio before going live.
technical_constraints.safe_area_note: Ensure faces and key visuals are not obscured by comments or UI.

required_elements: Single primary CTA repeated during the session
Opening hook that explains what viewers gain by staying
disallowed_practices: Long silent periods or idle time
